185984326.review: I'm not sure I've left more than one or two reviews in all the years I've been a steam user. I came here to say that this game has genuinely surprised me with how good it is. The combat is fine. People dumping on it can go play Fallout and get out of my face. This isn't a AAA title, but it has AAA writing. Every choice you make, even small ones, can lead to completely unexpected outcomes. And more than anything, I'm genuinely INTERESTED in the story. It's gritty. It's grey. And every twist and turn makes you appreciate that the writers never intended ANYONE to truly be a hero. It's about survival, and doing the best you can with what you have in front of you. And trying to make a decision you feel you can still respect yourself for. I love it.

185925192.review:
Как же в 16 году когда игра вышла, у меня текли слюнки на эту игру, но мой калькулятор на тот момент тянул ее очень с трудом. И наконец я в нее поиграл.
Многие пишут что игра короткая, но как по мне она идеальная по хронометражу, не короткая и не затянутая.
И пожалуй лучшая игра из не многих где можно отыграть за отрицательную сторону конфликта, но при этом не отыгрывать маньяка как допустим в каком нибудь BG3.
В игре очень много текста, из 50 часов, 20 часов только чтение. По началу такое обилие текста напрягало, но истории некоторых персонаже читал с огромным удовольствием.
Так же предполагаю что игра реиграбельна, как минимум на два прохождения, которые будут довольно сильно отличатся
Если нравятся такие партийные РПГ, то тем более по скидке берите не задумываясь

185909707.review: 极佳的美术风格和音乐，人物刻画优秀，但是游戏时间太短了，算是个不错的小品级作品。

185767074.review: I have never seen a game actively try to stop you from having fun. Every time that I start to fall in love with this game, it just layers on the most boring, inconsequential side content. If you plan to play this game focus on the main quest and ignore everything else, you are not missing anything good. Could not finish the game, deleted about 2/3 of the way.

185761210.review:
Pillars of eternityをプレイしよう！

◯世界観やキャラクター
Pillarsより世界観やキャラクターに奥行きがない。ベースゲームにはコンパニオンクエストがなく、6人中3人分のみ有料DLCにて拡張。

◯バトル
Pillarsより戦術性は低いにも関わらず、上限4人パーティのため火力が不足しがちで1戦が冗長。deadfireほどAIは賢くないためマニュアルが必要。

◯シナリオ
分岐が明確なため、それぞれのルートはリニアで息苦しい。主人公の立場上、クエストがお使い。

◯ロールプレイの幅
主人公のキャラが固まっており、RP用の選択肢は少ない。交流でも押し問答でもない一問一答の質問項目が会話の大半を占めており、主人公が勝手に喋っている印象。


act.2にて一時撤退、未クリア。

Pillars未プレイならあり(でも、Pillarsのが安いよ

185481277.review: I think it is a really good game, but this game does seem a little decisive. If you like PoE, or CRPGs in general, you will probably like this game. If not you still might like this game.

185435655.review: 第一章非常好玩甚至有神作潜力 但从第二章找基石那个任务开始就变得非常无聊 战斗占据大部分时间 地图也绕来绕去 从这里就弃了 感觉是黑耀石的试水作 但文本和人设很有趣 哎可惜了

185423912.review: A compelling story from a unique angle, a flexible magic system, an interesting setting in a transitioning bronze/iron age, a unique reputation system, a skill system that improves skills utilized, and a serviceable combat system make this a compelling acquisition for any fan of the crpg genre. Please keep in mind that most of the dialogue isn't voiced, so there's lots of reading which can slow your pace down. For downsides, the characters in combat can get wonky at times and some of the sarcastic dialogue options ended up resulting in permanent consequences that didn't seem obvious at the time. Definitely not fleshed out as Pillars of Eternity or Baldur's Gate, but still worth a romp.

185368885.review:
Очень качественная РПГ игра с большой разветвленностью по мере прохождения.
Очень хороший геймплей в плане разнообразия и отсутствия привязки персонажа к определенному классу за счёт доступных для каждого 6 веток развития таланта. Прокачка также осуществляется не за счёт стандартного выполнения квество (хотя за это тоже экспа капает), а за непосредственное использование умений, причем не обязательно самому кастовать определенную магию, чтобы получить в ней опыт, ты также получаешь опыт в определенных ветках, если компаньоны используют те или иные параметры, так забавно, что при прохождении проверок на "Знание" по завершению диалога компаньоны получают опыт в нём. Ну и в целом идея перевести эти характеристики во что-то, что прокачивается практически, а не при повышении уровня, выглядит очень достойно. Согласитесь, глупо же выглядить, когда варвар при повышении уровня получает очки к условной внимательности, хотя он по факту ни одного потаенного предмета не нашёл)
Очень хорошо выполнена система талантов и репутации, комбо-умения это прям свежая идея, но хотелось бы больше синергии между отдельными компаньонами, а не только между гг и спутником. Репутация на основе, которой дают те или иные плюшки выполнена качественно, особенно механика ненависти со стороны определенной фракции, где по достижению определенного значения уровня ненависти ты обычно получаешь талант связанный с тем, чтобы эффективнее вырезать ненавистников)
Особо порадовала система магии - как же уже надоели бесконечные крпг, которые базируются на ДнД, с одними и теми же спеллами, с одним и тем же действием, ну просто ужас, а здесь же ты творишь собственную магию, хоть и с знаком уже ранее жившего архонта) Было бы здорово, если бы имелась возможность найти в старых стенах уникальные руны, с которыми необходимо было бы экспериментировать в создании заклинаний, чтоб получить хоть какой-то эффект.

185206084.review: Для меня это первый опыт в таких играх но он определёно удался. Я знаю что могу играть и дальше раскрывая сильнее эту вселенную. Я не зря раскошелился. Игра стоить свеч.

185178996.review: Игра короткая, но насыщенная. Интересно, будет ли когда-то продолжение с масштабным замесом? А нужно ли это продолжение или баланс сил восстановлен..?

185109801.review:
"Juega a un RPG con decisiones relevantes capaces de alterar el mundo".

Y. Un. Co. Jón.

Presume de dar  agencia al jugador, que podrá construir  su historia como quiera. Pero eso solo es así con los rebeldes (y solo en los términos más generales de hacer  que apoyen a Kyros o garantizar la independencia de las Cotas). En la ruta de la anarquía  definitivamente no es así (no tienes más remedio que pegarte con todos,  que robarlo todo, que dejar Leizian desprotegido, etc), y tampoco es realmente así en la ruta de los desfavorecidos (por mucho que intentes insistir en que eres un agente de Kyros los cabrones  te seguirán tratando como si  fueras de ellos... y cuando llegues a EL MOMENTO cumbre de miseria moral de los desfavorecidos ni siquiera te dan la opción de decir "y un cojón, no vais a  hacer esto aunque tenga que mataros a todos" a pesar de que casi todos tus compañeros te gritan que hagas  justo eso). La del cántico no la he jugado, pero mi falta de opciones durante la ruta de los desfavorecidos me  ha dejado con tan mal sabor de boca que de momento no voy a tocar este juego.

Es una lástima porque promete. El  lore es maravilloso, el sistema de magia me ha gustado muchísimo, y hay decisiones muy interesantes, pero... No. No puedes venderme un juego con una especie de  premisa de "construye tu aventura" y luego no dejarme construir mi aventura. Es  un chiste de mal gusto.

185108285.review:
This game is incredible. 10/10

I love the story with all the choice to manipulate it along the way is absolutely perfect.

Lots of replayability.

The RPG elements are fantastic.

The combat is really good.

Exploration was very satisfying. I was always rewarded for exploring the maps.

I finished the game wanting the story to keep going.

Was pretty shocked by how small of a team made this game. The devs were clearly very experienced, passionate and hard working.

185097740.review: Its decision making at its finest and can be deeper than i thought. One thing is its around 20-40 hours depending on what you want to do. I've done 3 playthroughs and have enjoyed them all, Nerat is brutal and uhhhh have fun working "with" him. so many little details and stuff i missed every time, another cool feature is depending on early chouces it can actually change map locations, one changed a whole town.

185070185.review: great RPG. Feels like Baldurs gate but with more improvements and more user friendly

185048427.review: Короткая но хорошая рпг о власти и балансе сил

184993931.review:
Tyranny is... fine.
Personally, it failed to grab me and I didn't enjoy the setting or writing very much, but I can see why some say it's great.

184931689.review:

Instead this time you play part of the evil army who has defeated good and now rules the world crushing rebellion and resistance wherever you go.   However, you can subtly and very carefully undermine the evil folks you work for and work as a good guy if you wish, that option is there.

184824249.review:

184778247.review:
A cRPG that asks what you’ll do when the world has already fallen—and then lets you do it. Its writing is sharp, like glass cutting through ideology. Questions without easy answers. Characters who refuse to be mere tropes. Each conversation feels like a duel, your wit the blade you wield.

A masterpiece of writing, choice, and consequence.

184650389.review:
I loved the idea of this game, and have seen so many great reviews on yt and steam and decided to try it.

And as far as RPG stuff goes its been ok so far, BUT combat is stupidly hard... I even switched it to Story Mode and still cant pass even the most mundane random travel encounter... 

I have been playing games for 20 years now, but this is just unplayable for me... I feel gaslighted by all of these positive reviews, and I'm not even sure anymore if we are playing the same game?!

184601920.review:
Finished my first run and would reccomend.

Short-ish as far as CRPGs go and a fantastic introduction to Real Time with pause for anyone new to the genre.

The story is enjoyable and found the endings to be accurate to the kind of character I went for, immersion is possible.

Besides this the game is very easy, like laughably so depending on how you build your character, and some of the dungeons can get really dull when the ours start getting up into the 40s. 

Without the DLCS the companions are at best, OK. Though the ones that shine, Verse and Barik particularly, I enjoyed a good bit.

Overall, if your new to the CRPG genre and want to see what it's about, Tyranny is fantastic choice to play, id call it "babies first CRPG". Besides that its still a whole lot of fun and ive enjoyed my time with the game.

184576089.review: me diverti muito jogando esse jogo, um jogo com decisoes complexas e um mundo interessante, peca um pouco no final mas a joranada ainda é muito boa

184556582.review: It's a good time! Cool mythology, interesting characters, neat environments. Suffers a bit from the fact that the reputation system and ethical dilemmas turn almost every conversation into "who are you going to accidentally make mad by saying the wrong thing???" or "choose between this rock and this hard place, AGAIN!" but once I learned to roll with that I still had a good time.

184543342.review: игра в которой отыгрывать абсолютную мразь это не стыдно, а очень даже круто!

184507542.review:
I LOVE this games lore, backstory, and worldbuilding, plus the positioning and perspective of your character is super unique. Magic system is fun to, and is steeped pretty heavily in the lore to boot.

I do, however, have one major complaint about this game, and that it that it feels like it should be a lot longer, because it leaves so many questions and plotlines rather unresolved depending on the ending you take. That is the only thing keeping it from a five star for me. For most people that might not be a problem, but I love the worldbuilding of this game so much that when I learned where it ended, I won't lie, it kinda pissed me off.

God, I wish this game had a sequel, but it doesn't so I have to wallow in unexplained and unexplored lore, no matter how much I despise that fact.

184472879.review:
10/10 CRPG. No sos un héroe destinado a salvar el mundo, sino que vas a hacer la voluntad de tu jefe, un conquistador malvado, haciendo de juez entre 2 facciones subordinadas de Kyros, pudiendo fallar a favor de uno u otro según decisiones en base a tu moral, conveniencia politica o por sacarle dinero a los involucrados.

El sistema de mágia es de los mejores de todos los RPGs (junto con Morrowind), descubrimos magias y modificadores que haran que por ejemplo se hagan daños de hielo que se podra hacer a cuerpo a cuerpo, en un disparo que explote, una linea que destruye todo a su paso, o como modificador de arma con daño de hielo.

Uno de los mejores RPGs que jugué, solo por el mundo interesante que hay vale la pena, es muy distinto al clásico mundo de fantasia medieval del 99% de juegos de este tipo.

184390457.review:
My third favorite CRPG.

just an absolute bop on every level.

184378620.review: an instant classic rpg. loved the writing and the choices felt like they really mattered.

184254723.review: If you like active pause RPGs, give it a go. For me even though I feel the story is great, it proved to be too boring in combat encounters and there was waaaay too much text to read. Literary 70% of the game is reading through dialogue trees, spiced with multitude descriptions. It's almost like reading a novel - got me tired after a while.

184248218.review:
Another great cRPG by Obsidian, relatively short for a cRPG (30-35 hours) but it does some amazing stuff with factions, reputation and player choice. The premise is fairly unique, you're part of the invading force and a trusted servant to a tyrant named Kyros. 

There are plenty of paths you can take and choices to make that can drastically change quest/story outcomes and a lot of them are in the grey area, not strictly good/evil. You can also play a short narrative prologue to set up the initial state of the world or skip it and use a quick start option. 

I really enjoyed it and some of the lore/exploration areas were quite intriguing. I think Deadfire is still Obsidian's best (this review is prior to Avowed release), but Tyranny is a good cRPG with an emphasis on hard choices.

184232115.review:
Évaluation Steam de Tyranny
Temps de jeu : 20-40 heures

Recommandation : Positive

Histoire :
Tyranny propose une perspective unique dans le genre RPG : vous incarnez un Fatebinder, un agent du tyran Kyros, qui a déjà conquis presque tout le monde connu. L’histoire explore les conséquences de cette victoire et plonge le joueur dans des choix moraux complexes. Allez-vous imposer la loi impitoyable de Kyros, manipuler les factions pour vos propres intérêts, ou tenter de renverser l’ordre établi ? Les dialogues riches et les ramifications multiples des choix offrent une profondeur narrative fascinante et une rejouabilité élevée.

Gameplay :
Le gameplay est un mélange de RPG classique avec des combats en temps réel avec pause, une personnalisation riche des personnages, et un système de réputation qui influence vos relations avec les factions et compagnons. Les compétences et pouvoirs du personnage principal, combinés aux talents uniques des compagnons, permettent de créer des synergies variées en combat. Les choix narratifs ont un impact direct sur les quêtes et l’évolution du monde, donnant une véritable impression de contrôle sur l’histoire.

Graphismes :
Visuellement, Tyranny adopte un style isométrique détaillé, avec des environnements bien conçus qui reflètent l’oppression du monde sous le joug de Kyros. Les effets visuels des sorts et des capacités sont impressionnants, bien que certains décors puissent sembler répétitifs à la longue. Le style artistique sombre et cohérent s’aligne parfaitement avec le ton du jeu.

Difficulté :
Le jeu propose plusieurs niveaux de difficulté, s’adaptant aussi bien aux nouveaux venus qu’aux vétérans des RPG isométriques. Les combats nécessitent une gestion attentive des ressources et des compétences, particulièrement lors des affrontements contre des ennemis puissants. Les choix narratifs peuvent également poser des dilemmes qui impactent directement votre progression.

Durée de vie :
Avec une campagne principale d’environ 20 heures, Tyranny peut s’étendre à 40 heures ou plus en explorant les quêtes secondaires et en expérimentant les différentes branches narratives. Sa rejouabilité est élevée grâce aux nombreuses fins possibles et aux choix qui modifient drastiquement l’histoire et les relations avec les factions.

Prix (en solde) :
En solde, le jeu est souvent disponible pour moins de 10 euros, un excellent investissement pour un RPG aussi riche en contenu et en narration. Les fans de jeux comme Pillars of Eternity ou Baldur’s Gate trouveront dans Tyranny une expérience captivante à un prix avantageux.

Conclusion :
Tyranny se démarque par son approche innovante du bien et du mal, offrant un RPG narratif riche en choix et en conséquences. Avec son monde sombre, ses personnages bien écrits, et son gameplay stratégique, il s’adresse particulièrement aux amateurs de récits complexes et de RPG isométriques. Si vous recherchez une aventure où vos décisions ont un impact réel sur le monde, Tyranny est un incontournable, surtout à prix réduit.

184174147.review: Kdo má rád RPG hry, tak určitě doporučuji si tuto hru zahrát. Hra samotná zabere celkem hodně hodin a určitě si ji užijete. Příběh je velice zajímavý a určitě vás vtáhne do děje. Grafika je také velice hezká a rozhodně se vám bude líbit.

184101905.review: Sad that this game got no sequal! Liked it much more then Poe1-2 and the Pathfinder games and on top of it Tyranny has one of the best Magic systems ever made.

184067952.review: The most underrated RPG I've played. While the combat is passable, the story and setting make the entire experience worth it. The premise of the world is interesting enough that I would have read this in novel form, but being interactive fiction allowed for some really interesting decisions required by the player. If you like slow narrative based RPGS and can stomach mediocre gameplay, this might be something you'll enjoy. It's a shame we'll never get a sequel.

183941630.review: I played this game because of pillars but liked this game much better. Despite some frustration flaws with the real time fighting, I played through twice.

183931373.review: Tiene la identidad de obsidian, con lo que ello conlleva, una buena historia, buena banda sonora que reconoceras rapidamente, buena jugabilidad, y rejugabilidad 100%, si te gusto el apartado artistico de pillars of eternity (y los que hemos jugado sabeis a lo que merefiero) agradeceras este juego, si estas con la duda no te lo compres porque es un juego que te tiene que gustar mucho este tipo, ahora, si estas buscando algo asi en concreto, no te lo pienses

183848541.review:
So, I am giving this game a positive review because it has an interesting story to tell, and plenty of branching options to give you the chance for a solid replayability, which is very desirable IMO. On top of that, it doesn't take 100 hours to run through one playthrough like some RPGs, so replayability is actually reasonable with this story. The setting is well thought out, and built on thoroughly as you progress. 

All that said, I have some significant issues with the game:

1: While the world building is pretty good, the writers had a tendency to just put SO MUCH INFO on characters that do not matter. A prime example is a pair of soldiers that happen to be brothers. Your with them for all of 10 minutes, but they have text options that go way to deep on their personal interactions. There is plenty of chaff that could have been cut here, and towards the end of my playthrough, I just got tired of reading about things that didn't apply to the greater world or the main plot, and started skipping sections of conversations. I don't need to know intricate details about one-off characters. 

2: The combat is rough, and not in a difficulty type of way. I am not a big fan of RPGs that limit the party number below 6 characters, and this game does it. I just feel like there could team options with 6 compared to 4. This limited what I felt like I could do in regards to my team composition and so I tried to use the terrain to my advantage where possible, and it forced me to abuse chokepoints to prevent my weaker characters from just getting targeted down.

Add to that a janky movement system that will sometimes get a character stuck on nothing in a fight, or have them run around a teammate the long way to at the last moment realize the other way was shorter, and then turn around, and I just got frustrated and turned the combat to easy. The system itself is not intuitive IMO. I wasn't a huge fan of it in Pillars of Eternity, and after returning to it having played more solid systems based off of DND, it's weakness shows.

Overall, I do think it worth the time, considering that 30 hrs can see you the whole of the main story. Some of the companions have some deep expansion onto the world, and the most of the Archons have interesting interactions with the player character. Just stick it on easy, and don't get caught in the vortex of unnecessary character development.

183769519.review: Так это... Это ж... Мало! (с) Гуфовский. Буквально про эту игру. Ушло всего пару дней чтобы закрыть игру.

183606375.review: Combat is meh. But story is great.

183583214.review:
One of the best written rpg out there. A fresh air from all the dndesque settings that are usually found in fantasy rpgs, Tyranny's world has his own original twist inspired (I believe) from the Black Company universe.

Combat is fun and engaging, and the spell creation system offers lots of flexibility.

It's a shame that such a game has been rushed and offered such few additional content. Even like this, it's still a masterpiece of crpgs, imagine what it could have been with a continued support...

183566194.review: How can I write a review for this game, if I don't own it?
